description: In the CHFI series, Daniel and Adam will take you through all the concepts, tools, and best-practices you'll need to know for the CHFI exam. You'll be introduced to many different digital forensic techniques and duties like safely copying hard drives, how to perform as a "First Responder", searching for and recovering deleted files, steganographic techniques, common attack avenues, acting as an expert witness, and much more.
descriptionMD: In the CHFI series, Daniel and Adam will take you through all the concepts, tools, and best-practices you'll need to know for the CHFI exam. You'll be introduced to many different digital forensic techniques and duties like safely copying hard drives, how to perform as a "First Responder", searching for and recovering deleted files, steganographic techniques, common attack avenues, acting as an expert witness, and much more.
name: CHFI v9
subtitle: Computer Hacking Forensic Investigator

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give a general overview of what to expect in the upcoming CHFI version 9 series. They cover topics like who is the intended audience, what the scope of the series will cover, and what are some specific topics that will be addressed.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to look at the state of computer forensics in today's world. Here they build your foundational knowledge and vocabulary necessary for the CHFI exam and our series. Specific topics covered includes: Defining computer forensics and the objectives of computer forensics.
episodes.title: Computer Forensics in Todays World

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to look at the state of computer forensics in today's world. Here they build your foundational knowledge and vocabulary necessary for the CHFI exam and our series. Specific topics covered includes: Types of cyber crime, rules of forensic investigation, and methodology of forensic investigation.
episodes.title: Computer Forensics in Todays World Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to look at the state of computer forensics in today's world. Here they build your foundational knowledge and vocabulary necessary for the CHFI exam and our series. Specific topics covered includes: Types and characteristics of digital evidence, rules of digital evidence, and problems inherent to digital evidence.
episodes.title: Computer Forensics in Todays World Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to look at the state of computer forensics in today's world. Here they build your foundational knowledge and vocabulary necessary for the CHFI exam and our series. Specific topics covered includes: Federal Rules of Evidence regarding hearsay, hearsay exceptions, and submitting evidence in the form of writings, recordings, and/or photographs.
episodes.title: Computer Forensics in Todays World Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to look at the state of computer forensics in today's world. Here they build your foundational knowledge and vocabulary necessary for the CHFI exam and our series. Specific topics covered includes: International principles for digital evidence, forensic readiness planning, and the digital evidence examination process.
episodes.title: Computer Forensics in Todays World Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: The investigation process including the pre-investigation process, planning, and licensing.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: creating forensically sound copies of digital evidence, examination of the crime scene, basic software needs for your lab, and forensic law.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: authorization to act, risk assessment, the investigation steps, and building a forensics toolkit.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include:
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: a complete and condensed set of investigative steps/methodology as well as defining the role of first responder and their duties.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: Searching/Seizing computers, privacy, consent, exigent circumstances, and search strategies.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 6

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation process as a whole; explaining each step, procedure, and tool pertinent to the CHFI v9 exam. Specific topics covered here include: More on privacy, obtaining search warrants, surveillance, evidence gathering, and data/evidence integrity.
episodes.title: The Investigation Process Part 7

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam give you a rundown of the investigation tools commonly employed by a CHFI; explaining each in detail. Specific tools covered here include: Hash Calculator, Paraben Commander, and EaseUS Data Recovery.
episodes.title: Investigative Tools Demonstration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the pertinent information with regards to hard disks and file systems for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered here include: Drive types, hard drive physical components, logical structure, common file systems, interface connectors, density, and disk space.
episodes.title: Hard Disks and File Systems

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the pertinent information with regards to hard disks and file systems for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered here include: Disk partitioning, BIOS Parameter Block(BPB), Master Boot Record(MBR), GUID Partition Table(GPT), and Windows Boot Process.
episodes.title: Hard Disks and File Systems Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the pertinent information with regards to hard disks and file systems for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered here include: Mac and Linux Boot Process, in-depth discussion about types of file systems, and common RAID types.
episodes.title: Hard Disks and File Systems Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the pertinent information with regards to hard disks and file systems for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered here include: Host Protected Areas(HPA) and Device Configuration Overlays(DCO), File system analysis, File Carving, File structure, and viewing data with a Hex editor.
episodes.title: Hard Disks and File Systems Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam demonstrate a few forensic tools commonly used in the gathering of digital evidence from hard drives and file systems. Here you'll get to see tools like The Sleuth Kit(TSK) binaries such as fsstat, istat, and fls. You'll also get a look at Autopsy and more of the WinHex utility.
episodes.title: Forensic File System Tools Demonstration

topics.title: Understanding Hard Disks and File Systems

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the common methodologies and tools used in retrieving data and duplicating that data for the purposes of investigation. Specific topics covered here include: data acquisition defined, volatile vs non-volatile data, data collection methodology, and the order of volatility.
episodes.title: Data Acquisition and Duplication

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the common methodologies and tools used in retrieving data and duplicating that data for the purposes of investigation. Specific topics covered here include:
episodes.title: Data Acquisition and Duplication Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk through the common methodologies and tools used in retrieving data and duplicating that data for the purposes of investigation. Specific topics covered here include: Static data collection, data acquisition formats, guidelines for choosing data acquisition tools, and the static data acquisition methodology.
episodes.title: Data Acquisition and Duplication Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam walk you through using some common forensic tools for gathering digital evidence from a digital storage device. Here they demonstrate tools like AccessData FTK Imager and Disk Explorer for NTFS to create disk images and view that data in a forensically sound way.
episodes.title: Data Acquisition Tools Demonstration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to explore some of the methods that bad actors use to avoid detection and hinder forensic investigation. Specific topics covered here include: Anti-Forensic defined as well as its goals and techniques.
episodes.title: Defeating Anti-Forensic Techniques

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to explore some of the methods that bad actors use to avoid detection and hinder forensic investigation. Specific topics covered here include: deleted file recovery in Windows, Linux, and Mac OS, as well as deleted partition recovery.
episodes.title: Defeating Anti-Forensic Techniques Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to explore some of the methods that bad actors use to avoid detection and hinder forensic investigation. Specific topics covered here include: Password protection, password attacks, default password lists, and lastly, steganography introduced and defined.
episodes.title: Defeating Anti-Forensic Techniques Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take time to explore some of the methods that bad actors use to avoid detection and hinder forensic investigation. Specific topics covered here include: types of attacks on steganography, image file types used in stego, rootkits, and countermeasures to Anti-Forensics.
episodes.title: Defeating Anti-Forensic Techniques Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a few minutes to demonstrate a few tools that can be used to crack passwords and perform steganography/steganalysis. Tools covered here include: Advanced PDF Cracker(APDFPR), StegSpy Steg-Detector, and OpenStego.
episodes.title: Anti-Forensics Tools Demonstration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: MS Windows forensic methodology and volatile information gathering.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: Gathering process info, print spool files, info gathering from clipboard/doskey/shares, and non-volatile info gathering.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: event logs, ESE database files, hibernate files, pagefiles, web browser cached files, and Windows memory analysis.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: Windows Registry analysis, wireless SSID cached info, UserAssist Keys, and Most Recently Used(MRU) lists.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: Autorun Software, Cache/Cookie/History Analysis, Recycle Bin forensics, System Restore Points forensics, Windows Logon Event types, and Server Logs.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore digital forensics with regards to the Operating Systems of computer systems. Here they will explain forensic methodologies used when gather information for investigative purposes in a forensically sound manner. Specific topic(s) here includes: Linux forensics and Mac OS forensics.
episodes.title: Operating System Forensics Part 6

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore network forensics from a CHFI perspective. Here they will look over some foundational networking concepts as well as key areas of networking that a CHFI would need to be aware of to be effective. Specific topic here include: Network Forensics defined, common network attacks, and attacks specific to wireless networks.
episodes.title: Network Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore network forensics from a CHFI perspective. Here they will look over some foundational networking concepts as well as key areas of networking that a CHFI would need to be aware of to be effective. Specific topic here include: OSI Model overview, Legal issues associated with using logs as evidence, and Event Correlation.
episodes.title: Network Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore network forensics from a CHFI perspective. Here they will look over some foundational networking concepts as well as key areas of networking that a CHFI would need to be aware of to be effective. Specific topic here include: Correlation approaches, the importance of NTP, log management systems, and logging in Linux, Windows, Syslog, and IIS.
episodes.title: Network Forensics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore network forensics from a CHFI perspective. Here they will look over some foundational networking concepts as well as key areas of networking that a CHFI would need to be aware of to be effective. Specific topic here include: Analyzing router logs, logs for Cisco and Juniper, IDS/IPS logs, Honeyepot logs, and Fundamentals of reconstruction of a crime.
episodes.title: Network Forensics Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: challenges facing web forensics.
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: OWASP top 10 vulnerabilities, buffer overflows, cookie poisoning, insecure storage, and information leakage.
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: improper error handling, broken account management, directory traversal, sql injection, form tampering, unvalidated input, log tampering, and denial of service(DOS/DDOS).
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: Cross Site Scripting(XSS)/Cross Site Request Forgery, SSL/TLS Downgrade, Authentication Hijack, Hidden Field Manipulation, and more.
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: investigation methodology of web attacks, IIS log overview, Apache vs IIS, and elements of the Apache core.
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam take a look at the many differing types of web based attacks and then go into the methodology of investigating them. Specific topics covered here include: Apache log overview and default location for error logs.
episodes.title: Investigating Web Attacks Part 6

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore what you'll need to know concerning databases for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered include: Familiarization with Microsoft's MySQL databases, file types, log files, and the collection of active transaction log files.
episodes.title: Database Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam explore what you'll need to know concerning databases for the CHFI exam. Specific topics covered include: collecting trace files, collecting error logs, methodology for database forensics, InnoDB, etc.
episodes.title: Database Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam jump into the cloud to see what we'll need to know about this technology as CHFIs. Specific topics covered include: defining characteristics of the cloud, cloud service models (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), and cloud deployment models (Public/Private/Hybrid/Community).
episodes.title: Cloud Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam jump into the cloud to see what we'll need to know about this technology as CHFIs. Specific topics covered include: cloud specific attacks and categories of cloud crime. They also perform a demonstration of a memory dump.
episodes.title: Cloud Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam jump into the cloud to see what we'll need to know about this technology as CHFIs. Specific topics covered include: Cloud specific forensic challenges like data in multiple locations, decreased access and data control, resource abstraction, and more.
episodes.title: Cloud Forensics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam jump into the cloud to see what we'll need to know about this technology as CHFIs. Specific topics covered include: Cloud storage services like Dropbox and Google Drive, then familiarizing you with default configurations for both.
episodes.title: Cloud Forensics Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam dive into the fascinating world of Malware forensics. Here they will take the time to thoroughly explore and explain each type of malware that you may encounter as a CHFI, including: Backdoors, Rootkits, Botnets, Scareware, Downloaders, Spam-sending malware, Launchers, Worms or virus, and Credential-stealing programs
episodes.title: Malware Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Adam dive into the fascinating world of Malware forensics. Here they will take the time to thoroughly explore and explain each type of malware that you may encounter as a CHFI, including: Basic malware components, malware analysis techniques, VirusTotal demo, PE-View demo, and Dependency Walker demo.
episodes.title: Malware Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Adam discuss how E-Mail can play an important role when it comes to investigating email crimes. Adam explains the client/server architecture and explains the differences between common methods such as SMTP, POP3, and IMAP4. They also dissect the anatomy of an E-Mail by breaking it down into three sections. Tune in now to learn which of those sections can provide the information during an investigation.
episodes.title: Investigating Email Crimes

episodes.description: In this show, Adam and Cherokee continue their discussion around E-Mail crimes. First, Adam walks thru an 8 step method best practice guide.  Adam shares a useful link, http://centralops.net to help perform certain tests. They them cover different encoding methods such as MIME, Uuencoding, and BinHex. Next they discuss where logs are retained within different OS environments. Specifically, Adam shows files locations within  Linux and Windows server environment. Lastly, U.S laws relating E-Mail crimes are noted.
episodes.title: Investigating Email Crimes Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Adam demonstrate how to use different investigative tools. First, Adam shows how to import a .PST file to examine it within Recover My Email.  Next, he shows how Paraben Email Examiner can be used to start compiling and analyzing  forensic evidence. They continue to examine E-Mail info, specifically, they use E-mail Tracker Pro to find an origin of an email based upon header information.
episodes.title: Investigating Email Crimes Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Adam begin speaking about mobile forensics. First, they talk about different areas information can me stored such as internal storage, SIM cards or other external card types. The mobile device forensics process is also noted. Adam explains the six components of a cellular network as well as sharing some cell network examples.
episodes.title: Mobile Forensics

episodes.description: In this episode, Adam and Cherokee continue talking about mobile forensics. Adam explains there are two sides to every conversation. Not only on the client side but that the service provider may retain useful information as well. Adam calls out specific information contained with in call detail records. Next, learn three components in the SIM files system hierarchy and risks associated with becoming locked out of a SIM if PIN codes or PUKs (Personal Unlock Numbers) are incorrectly entered.
episodes.title: Mobile Forensics Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Adam and Cherokee shows a few tools that can assist in mobile forensics. First they look at Mobile Edit and Sim Card Cloner to create clones of the phone OS and the SIM card. Next, they use Autopsy to examine the clones for forensic analysis.
episodes.title: Mobile Forensics Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Adam cover details surrounding how to report and present forensic information. Adam shares an example of an Forensics Report. He also explains how to qualify to become an expert witness. The Daubert Standard is explained as well as the order a a trial.
episodes.title: Forensics Report Writing and Presentation
